workflow.name: Screen DPDP consent manager registrations with GPT-4o, Google Sheets and Gmail
workflow.description:
## üìò Description
This workflow automates the complete DPDP-aligned Consent Manager Registration screening pipeline ‚Äî from intake to eligibility evaluation and final compliance routing.
Every incoming registration request is normalized, validated, logged, evaluated by an AI compliance engine (GPT-4o), and then routed into either approval or rejection flows.
It intelligently handles missing documentation (treated as a minor issue), evaluates financial/technical/operational capacity, generates structured eligibility JSON, updates registration records in Google Sheets, and sends outcome-specific emails to applicants and compliance teams.
 The workflow creates a full audit trail while reducing manual screening workload and ensuring consistent eligibility decisions.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Receive Consent Registration Event (Webhook)
 Collects incoming Consent Manager registration applications and triggers the processing pipeline.
üßπ Extract & Normalize Registration Payload (Code Node)
 Cleans the body payload and extracts key fields:
 action, organizationName, applicationType, contactEmail, netWorth, technicalCapacity, operationalCapacity, documentAttached, submittedAt.
üîç Validate Registration Payload Structure (IF Node)
 Checks the presence of mandatory fields.
 Valid ‚Üí continue to eligibility evaluation
 Invalid ‚Üí log in the audit sheet.
üìÑ Log Invalid Registration Requests to Sheet (Google Sheets)
 Stores malformed or incomplete submissions for audit, follow-up, and retry handling.
üìù Write Initial Registration Entry to Sheet (Google Sheets)
 Creates the initial intake row in the master registration sheet before applying eligibility logic.
üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äî Eligibility Evaluation Model (Azure OpenAI)
 Prepares the AI model used to determine whether the applicant meets DPDP‚Äôs eligibility criteria.
ü§ñ AI Eligibility Evaluator (DPDP Compliance)
 Analyzes applicant data and evaluates their eligibility based on:
 financial capacity, technical capability, operational readiness, and documentation status.
 Missing documents ‚Üí NOT a rejection condition.
 Returns strictly formatted JSON with: eligible, riskLevel, decisionReason, missingItems, recommendedNextSteps.
üßº Parse AI Eligibility JSON Output (Code Node)
 Converts AI output into valid JSON by removing markdown artifacts and ensuring safe parsing.
üîé Validate Eligibility Status (IF Node)
 Routes the outcome:
 Eligible ‚Üí approval workflow
 Ineligible ‚Üí rejection email.
üìß Send Rejection Email to Applicant (Gmail)
 Sends a structured rejection email listing issues and re-submission instructions.
üîó Merge Registration + Eligibility Summary (Code Node)
 Combines raw registration data with AI eligibility results into one unified JSON package.
üì¨ Send Approval Email to Compliance Team (Gmail)
 Notifies compliance officers that an applicant passed eligibility and is ready for verification.
üß© Prepare Status Update Fields (Set Node)
 Constructs the final status value (e.g., ‚Äúpassed‚Äù) for updating the database.
üìò Update Registration Status in Sheet (Google Sheets)
 Updates the applicant‚Äôs record using contactEmail as the key, marking the final eligibility status.

## üß© Prerequisites
Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o) credentials
Gmail OAuth connection
Google Sheets OAuth connection
Valid webhook endpoint for intake

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úî Fully automates DPDP Consent Manager registration screening
 ‚úî AI-driven eligibility evaluation with standardized JSON output
 ‚úî Smart handling of missing documents without unnecessary rejections
 ‚úî Automatic routing to approval or rejection flows
 ‚úî Complete audit logs for all submissions
 ‚úî Reduces manual review time and improves consistency

## üë• Perfect For
- DPDP compliance teams
- Regulatory operations units
- SaaS platforms handling consent manager onboarding
- Organizations managing structured eligibility workflows

workflow.name: Automated Consent Manager Registration Screening & Eligibility Evaluation Pipeline (DPDP-Aligned)

nodes.name: Log Invalid Registration Requests to Sheet

parameters.text:
=Evaluate the following Consent Manager Registration request and determine whether the applicant 
should be considered ELIGIBLE under DPDP standards.

IMPORTANT LOGIC CHANGES:
- If documentation is missing (documentAttached = null) but all other criteria are strong, 
  DO NOT reject the applicant. Instead, mark them as eligible and recommend that documentation 
  be collected during the verification stage.
- Only mark the applicant as ineligible if there is a MAJOR compliance failure 
  (e.g., extremely low net worth, no technical capacity, no operational capacity, fake data).

Here is the registration request:
{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Return the result in this exact JSON structure:

{
  "eligible": true or false,
  "decisionReason": "short explanation",
  "riskLevel": "Low / Medium / High",
  "missingItems": ["..."],
  "recommendedNextSteps": "What the compliance team should do next (short)"
}

If the only issue is missing documentation, still return:
"eligible": true
"riskLevel": "Low" 
and include the missing document note in "missingItems".

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI compliance assistant evaluating DPDP Consent Manager Registration requests.

RULES:
- Treat missing documentation as a minor issue (NOT a cause for rejection).
- Prioritize: financial capacity, technical capacity, operational capacity, email validity.
- If core requirements are met, the applicant should be considered "eligible".
- Only reject if the organization fundamentally cannot qualify.

Output must ALWAYS follow the JSON format exactly.

parameters.subject: =Consent Manager Registration ‚Äì Rejected (Missing Documents)

nodes.name: Send Approval Email to Compliance Team

parameters.message:
=

Dear Compliance Team,

A new Consent Manager registration request has passed the eligibility evaluation and is now ready for the verification stage.

üìå Applicant Details

  • Organization: {{ $json.registrationPackage.organizationName }}
  • Application Type: {{ $json.registrationPackage.applicationType }}
  • Contact Email: {{ $json.registrationPackage.contactEmail }}
  • Net Worth (‚Çπ): {{ $json.registrationPackage.netWorth }}

üìå Technical Capacity Summary

{{ $json.registrationPackage.technicalCapacity }}

üìå Operational Capacity Summary

{{ $json.registrationPackage.operationalCapacity }}

üìå Eligibility Result

  • Status: Eligible
  • Risk Level: {{ $json.eligibility.riskLevel }}
  • Reason: {{ $json.eligibility.decisionReason }}

üìå Missing Items

The following items must be collected during the verification stage:

üìå Next Steps

{{ $json.eligibility.recommendedNextSteps }}


Regards,
DPDP Automated Registration System
Compliance Automation (n8n)
parameters.subject: =Consent Manager Registration ‚Äì Eligibility Approved (Verification Stage)

nodes.name: Write Initial Registration Entry to Sheet

parameters.content:
## üìù Automated Consent Manager Registration Screening & Eligibility Evaluation Pipeline (DPDP-Aligned)

Automates intake, validation, eligibility evaluation, and routing of Consent Manager Registration applications under DPDP guidelines.  
Every incoming registration request is normalized, validated, evaluated using AI-based compliance logic, logged to Sheets, and then routed to either Approval or Rejection flow.  
The workflow ensures correct handling of missing documents, validates operational/technical capacity, and updates master records automatically.

üîπ Workflow Overview
1Ô∏è‚É£ Webhook receives new registration request  
2Ô∏è‚É£ Extracts & cleans core form fields  
3Ô∏è‚É£ Validates structure (action + mandatory values)  
4Ô∏è‚É£ Writes initial registration entry to Google Sheets  
5Ô∏è‚É£ AI performs eligibility evaluation (DPDP criteria)  
6Ô∏è‚É£ Parses JSON & validates eligibility result  
7Ô∏è‚É£ If **eligible** ‚Üí build summary + email compliance + update Sheet status  
8Ô∏è‚É£ If **ineligible** ‚Üí send rejection email + log for follow-up  
9Ô∏è‚É£ All invalid requests (missing core payload) are logged separately  

üîπ Tools & Integrations  
Webhook ‚Üí Intake  
Code Nodes ‚Üí Payload extraction, merging, JSON parsing  
Google Sheets ‚Üí Registration recordkeeping + status updates  
Azure GPT-4o ‚Üí Eligibility evaluation engine  
Gmail ‚Üí Rejection & Approval notifications  
Set Node ‚Üí Status field creation for final update

## Receive Consent Registration Event  
Webhook collects new registration submissions from the UI.  
Triggers workflow execution immediately and passes the raw payload forward.

## Extract & Normalize Registration Payload  
Cleans the incoming JSON body and extracts essential registration fields.  
Normalizes values into a consistent structure for downstream validation.

## Validate Registration Payload Structure  
Checks whether core fields (like action) are present and properly structured.  
Valid entries move to evaluation ‚Üí invalid entries go to the logging sheet.

## Log Invalid Registration Requests to Sheet  
Records malformed or incomplete submissions in a dedicated audit sheet.  
Supports retry handling and compliance tracking for improper requests.

## Write Initial Registration Entry to Sheet  
Stores the raw registration data into the main registration sheet.  
Creates the intake record before AI eligibility processing begins.

## Configure GPT-4o ‚Äî Eligibility Evaluation Model  
Prepares the AI model used to evaluate DPDP compliance eligibility.  
Serves as the language model input for the eligibility agent.

## AI Eligibility Evaluator (DPDP Compliance)  
Analyzes DPDP eligibility based on financial, technical, and operational criteria.  
Produces a structured JSON result with eligibility, risk level, and next steps.

## Parse AI Eligibility JSON Output  
Cleans markdown artifacts and safely converts AI output into valid JSON.  
Ensures standardized data for all branching decisions ahead.

## Validate Eligibility Status  
Checks whether the AI-determined eligibility is true or false.  
Routes eligible applicants to approval flow ‚Üí ineligible ones to rejection.

## Send Rejection Email to Applicant  
Sends a structured rejection email explaining missing/invalid elements.  
Guides applicants with clear next steps for re-submission.

## Merge Registration + Eligibility Summary  
Combines cleaned registration data with AI evaluation output.  
Creates a single structured summary for internal compliance review.

## Send Approval Email to Compliance Team  
Notifies compliance that an applicant passed eligibility checks.  
Includes applicant details, capacity overview, and risk assessment.

## Prepare Status Update Fields  
Sets the final status field (e.g., ‚Äúpassed‚Äù) for database update.  
Prepares the output required for updating the registration sheet.

## Update Registration Status in Sheet  
Updates the existing registration record using contactEmail as the key.  
Stores final eligibility status, forming a complete audit trail.

main.node: Write Initial Registration Entry to Sheet
Log Invalid Registration Requests to Sheet
Send Approval Email to Compliance Team

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
